title: 2 Peter Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 2 Peter with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 3 chapters.

questions.question: Who is the author of the second epistle addressed in 2 Peter?
questions.correctAnswer: Simon Peter
questions.explanation: The epistle begins by identifying the author as Simon Peter, a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:2, through what is grace and peace multiplied to believers?
options: Through faith in the Holy Spirit
Through the knowledge of God and Jesus our Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Through the knowledge of God and Jesus our Lord
questions.explanation: Grace and peace are multiplied through the knowledge of God and Jesus our Lord.

questions.question: What has God's divine power given us according to 2 Peter 1:3?
options: All things that pertain unto life and godliness
The power to heal the sick
questions.correctAnswer: All things that pertain unto life and godliness
questions.explanation: God's divine power has given us all things that pertain unto life and godliness through the knowledge of Him.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a virtue to add to faith in 2 Peter 1:5-7?
questions.correctAnswer: Humility
questions.explanation: Humility is not explicitly listed; the virtues are virtue, knowledge, temperance, patience, godliness, brotherly kindness, and charity.

questions.question: What will those who lack these qualities be described as in 2 Peter 1:9?
options: Blind and cannot see afar off
questions.correctAnswer: Blind and cannot see afar off
questions.explanation: Those who lack these qualities are blind and cannot see afar off, having forgotten that they were purged from their old sins.

questions.question: What does Peter urge believers to do to make their calling and election sure?
options: Give diligence to add virtues to faith
questions.correctAnswer: Give diligence to add virtues to faith
questions.explanation: Peter urges believers to give diligence to add to their faith virtue, knowledge, temperance, and other qualities so they may never fall.

questions.question: What kind of word does Peter say we have regarding the prophecy of Christ's coming?
options: A more sure word of prophecy
questions.correctAnswer: A more sure word of prophecy
questions.explanation: Peter says we have a more sure word of prophecy, to which we do well to take heed as a light shining in a dark place.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:21, how did prophecy come about?
options: By holy men of God moved by the Holy Ghost
questions.correctAnswer: By holy men of God moved by the Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: Prophecy came not by the will of man but by holy men of God who spake as they were moved by the Holy Ghost.

questions.question: What is the consequence for false teachers who bring in damnable heresies according to 2 Peter 2:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Swift destruction
questions.explanation: False teachers who deny the Lord and bring in damnable heresies bring swift destruction upon themselves.

questions.question: Who was saved as the eighth person during the flood according to 2 Peter 2:5?
questions.correctAnswer: Noah
questions.explanation: Noah, described as a preacher of righteousness, was saved as the eighth person during the flood.

questions.question: What example does Peter give of cities turned to ashes for ungodliness?
questions.correctAnswer: Sodom and Gomorrha
questions.explanation: The cities of Sodom and Gomorrha were turned to ashes and condemned as an example to ungodly people.

questions.question: How does Peter describe false teachers in 2 Peter 2:17?
options: Wells without water, clouds carried with a tempest
questions.correctAnswer: Wells without water, clouds carried with a tempest
questions.explanation: False teachers are described as wells without water and clouds carried with a tempest, reserved for darkness forever.

questions.question: What is said about those who have escaped the pollutions of the world but are again entangled in them?
options: Their latter end is better than the beginning
Their latter end is worse than the beginning
questions.correctAnswer: Their latter end is worse than the beginning
questions.explanation: Those who have escaped the pollutions but become entangled again have a latter end worse than the beginning.

questions.question: What proverb does Peter use to describe those who turn back to sin after knowing righteousness?
options: The lion and the lamb shall lie down together
The dog is turned to his own vomit again
questions.correctAnswer: The dog is turned to his own vomit again
questions.explanation: Peter quotes the proverb that the dog is turned to his own vomit and the washed sow to the wallowing in the mire.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Peter's second epistle as stated in 2 Peter 3:1?
options: To stir up pure minds by way of remembrance
questions.correctAnswer: To stir up pure minds by way of remembrance
questions.explanation: Peter writes this epistle to stir up the pure minds of believers by way of remembrance.

questions.question: Who does Peter say will come in the last days according to 2 Peter 3:3?
options: Scoffers walking after their own lusts
questions.correctAnswer: Scoffers walking after their own lusts
questions.explanation: Peter warns that scoffers will come in the last days, walking after their own lusts.

questions.question: What question do the scoffers ask in 2 Peter 3:4?
options: Where is the promise of his coming?
Who is the Son of God?
questions.correctAnswer: Where is the promise of his coming?
questions.explanation: Scoffers question the promise of the Lord's coming, saying all things continue as they were since creation.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3:6, how did the world that then was perish?
questions.correctAnswer: By flood
questions.explanation: The world that then was perished being overflowed with water in the flood.

questions.question: What are the heavens and the earth now reserved unto as stated in 2 Peter 3:7?
options: Fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men
questions.correctAnswer: Fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men
questions.explanation: The current heavens and earth are reserved unto fire for the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.

questions.question: How does Peter describe one day with the Lord compared to a thousand years?
options: One day is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day
One day is longer than a thousand years
One day is shorter than a thousand years
One day is equal to one year
questions.correctAnswer: One day is as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day
questions.explanation: Peter explains that with the Lord, one day is as a thousand years and a thousand years as one day.

questions.question: What is the reason the Lord is not slack concerning His promise?
options: He is longsuffering and desires all to come to repentance
questions.correctAnswer: He is longsuffering and desires all to come to repentance
questions.explanation: The Lord is longsuffering, not willing that any should perish but that all should come to repentance.

questions.question: How will the day of the Lord come according to 2 Peter 3:10?
options: Like a thief in the night
questions.correctAnswer: Like a thief in the night
questions.explanation: The day of the Lord will come unexpectedly like a thief in the night.

questions.question: What will happen to the elements on the day of the Lord as described in 2 Peter 3:10?
options: They shall melt with fervent heat
questions.correctAnswer: They shall melt with fervent heat
questions.explanation: The elements will melt with fervent heat on the day of the Lord.

questions.question: What manner of persons does Peter say we ought to be in light of all these things being dissolved?
questions.correctAnswer: Holy in conversation and godliness
questions.explanation: Peter urges believers to live holy and godly lives as all these things will be dissolved.

questions.question: What new hope does Peter mention in 2 Peter 3:13?
options: A new heaven and a new earth wherein dwelleth righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: A new heaven and a new earth wherein dwelleth righteousness
questions.explanation: Peter speaks of looking for new heavens and a new earth where righteousness dwells.

questions.question: How does Peter describe the epistles of Paul in 2 Peter 3:16?
questions.correctAnswer: Hard to be understood
questions.explanation: Peter says Paul's epistles contain some things hard to be understood which some wrest to their own destruction.

questions.question: What warning does Peter give at the end of 2 Peter 3?
options: Beware lest ye be led away with the error of the wicked and fall from your steadfastness
questions.correctAnswer: Beware lest ye be led away with the error of the wicked and fall from your steadfastness
questions.explanation: Peter warns believers to beware being led away by error and falling from their steadfastness.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 1:16, what did Peter and the others witness firsthand?
options: The power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: The power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Peter states they were eyewitnesses of the majesty, power, and coming of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: What voice did Peter hear from heaven during the holy mount experience?
options: "This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased"
questions.correctAnswer: "This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased"
questions.explanation: Peter heard the voice from heaven declaring Jesus as God's beloved Son.

questions.question: What does 2 Peter 2:9 say about the Lord's knowledge and deliverance?
options: The Lord will not deliver the godly
The Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptations and reserve the unjust unto judgment
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptations and reserve the unjust unto judgment
questions.explanation: The Lord is able to deliver the godly and reserve the unjust for the day of judgment.

questions.question: What kind of creatures does Peter compare false teachers to in 2 Peter 2:12?
questions.correctAnswer: Natural brute beasts
questions.explanation: False teachers are likened to natural brute beasts made to be taken and destroyed.

questions.question: Who is mentioned as an example of someone rebuked by a dumb ass speaking with man's voice?
questions.correctAnswer: Balaam the son of Bosor
questions.explanation: Balaam was rebuked for his iniquity by his dumb ass speaking with a man's voice.

questions.question: According to 2 Peter 3:12, what is the attitude believers should have toward the coming of the day of God?
options: Looking for and hasting unto it
questions.correctAnswer: Looking for and hasting unto it
questions.explanation: Believers are to look for and hasten the coming of the day of God.

questions.question: What does Peter say about the long-suffering of the Lord in 2 Peter 3:15?
options: It is a sign of weakness
questions.correctAnswer: It is salvation
questions.explanation: Peter says the longsuffering of the Lord is salvation.

questions.question: What should believers grow in according to 2 Peter 3:18?
options: Grace and knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Grace and knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Believers are encouraged to grow in grace and in the knowledge of Jesus Christ.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 1:20 states that prophecy of Scripture is of private interpretation.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: The verse states that no prophecy of Scripture is of any private interpretation.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 2:4 says God spared the angels that sinned without punishment.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: God did not spare the angels who sinned but cast them down to hell and delivered them into chains of darkness.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Peter 2:19, false teachers promise liberty but are servants of corruption.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: False teachers promise liberty but themselves are servants of corruption.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 3:10 indicates that the works on the earth shall be preserved on the day of the Lord.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: The verse says the earth and the works that are therein shall be burned up.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 3:9 teaches that the Lord is slack concerning his promise.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: The Lord is not slack but is longsuffering, not willing that any should perish.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Peter 2:22, the sow that was washed will not return to wallowing in the mire.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: The sow that was washed returns to wallowing in the mire, illustrating those who return to sin.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 1:11 promises an abundant entrance into the everlasting kingdom for those who add to their faith.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: Those who add to their faith will be given abundant entrance into the everlasting kingdom.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 2:10 describes false teachers as self-willed and not afraid to speak evil of dignities.
questions.correctAnswer: true
questions.explanation: False teachers are presumptuous, self-willed, and unafraid to speak evil of dignities.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Peter 3:13 refers to looking for a new heaven and a new earth where unrighteousness dwells.
questions.correctAnswer: false
questions.explanation: The new heaven and earth will be where righteousness dwells, not unrighteousness.

questions.question: Fill-blank: Complete this verse from 2 Peter 1:4 - 'Whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious ___________:'
questions.correctAnswer: promises
questions.explanation: The verse speaks of exceeding great and precious promises given to us.
